meanings.sent1: The room looked overlit with all the bright lights on.
meanings.sent2: The overlit sign outside the store was blinding to passersby.
meanings.sent3: The overlit party made everyone squint and look like they were in a spotlight.
meanings.sent4: The overlit street resembled a movie set rather than a quiet neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The overlit stage made the actors' faces shine like stars in the night sky.

meanings.sent1: Please do not overlit the room, as it hurts my eyes.
meanings.sent2: The photographer accidentally overlit the picture, washing out all the details.
meanings.sent3: The chef overlit the dish with too much garnish, making it look like a Christmas tree.
meanings.sent4: The flashlight overlit the dark alley, revealing hidden shadows lurking in corners.
meanings.sent5: The stadium lights overlit the field, making it seem like daytime even at night.

meanings.sent1: The overlit room felt too bright and uncomfortable to relax in.
meanings.sent2: The overlit street made it hard to see the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The overlit display in the store made the colors look unnatural and harsh.
meanings.sent4: The overlit screen of the phone drained the battery quickly.
meanings.sent5: The overlit sky at noon made it feel like the middle of the day even though it was morning.
